name: Fatui
desc: A Snezhnayan organization that is loyal to the Tsaritsa and has spread out all over the continent. Its Harbingers are on the hunt for the Gnoses.

customize.text: Trailers and Story Teasers
A Winter Night's Lazzo

<color=#ffd780>July 11, 2022</color>
No one knows how long it has been since all the Fatui Harbingers last gathered.
On this winter night, people donning masks who had just been singing and squabbling, fell silent in mournful meditation.
Only then did the hall join the winter sky in infinite silence.
Meanwhile, in distant Sumeru, Collei who has not had dreams for a long time, saw strange visions during her midday nap...
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
"The Song Burning in the Embers"

<color=#ffd780>April 17, 2024</color>
Some believe that growing up is to gradually break free from the shackles.
Fate sets the most brutal rules for us, turning day into night, leaving the future dwelling in but the lingering warmth of dreams.
Thus, our weapons clash, burying the remnants of another setting sun, and welcoming the next rising dawn.
Then, when the cage shatters, once and for all—
May gentle flames envelop the shriveled flowers, with their song echoing in the embers.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Cutscene Animation: "Goodbye"

<color=#ffd780>April 30, 2024</color>
On this night, several members left the House of the Hearth.
Some have a new future ahead of them, all except for one, who has reached the end of her journey.
When dawn breaks and illuminates what remains, it is time to say goodbye.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Teyvat Chapter Interlude Teaser: The Gods' Limits

<color=#ffd780>July 9, 2025</color>
In the council of gods, no mortal voice is ever heard.
And thus was the fate of the world arbitrarily determined.
We know that such is the way of the world.
But do the gods act out of contempt...
Or have they at some hour begun to act out of fear?
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Relationships

customize.name: Tsaritsa
customize.desc: The Cryo Archon of Snezhnaya.

customize.text: The Fatui serve the Cryo Archon of Snezhnaya.
Fatui Harbingers

customize.name: Pierro
customize.desc: The first Fatuus, also known as The Jester. He was a royal mage in Khaenri'ah and was cursed with immortality.

customize.text: Leader and the first Fatui Harbinger, known as The Jester. He is a former
mage who couldn't save his kingdom.

customize.name: Il Capitano
customize.desc: The First of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers and the Sentinel Knight of Khaenri'ah. His real name is Thrain.

customize.text: The First of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Captain. He is a former Khaenri'ahn captain who couldn't protect his kingdom. The Captain and his subordinates fought for Natlan during the

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.text: 500 years ago and during the Abyss invasion. He sacrificed himself to restore the Ley Lines in Natlan and to turn the curse of immortality against

customize.name: Ronova
customize.desc: The Ruler of Death, one of the Primordial One's Shades.

customize.text: . After the duel with

customize.name: Mavuika
customize.desc: The leader of Natlan who inherited the Ancient Name of "Kiongozi." She made a vow to illuminate the future of the nation of war with the Sacred Flame.

customize.text: , The Captain asked the Tsaritsa to remove him from the responsibility of obtaining the Gnosis, and his request was granted. After his sacrifice, the Tsaritsa decided to keep his position.

customize.name: Il Dottore
customize.desc: The Second of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, codenamed The Doctor. Had multiple "segments" of himself, nearly all of which he destroyed in a deal with the Dendro Archon.

customize.text: The Second of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Doctor. He is a former scholar of the

customize.name: Sumeru Akademiya
customize.desc: The Sumeru organization, which exercises administrative control over the region and educates people.

customize.text: who was expelled about 400 years ago. The Doctor had multiple segments of himself that were erased as a deal with the Dendro Archon.

customize.text: The Third of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Damselette.

customize.name: Arlecchino
customize.desc: The Fourth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Knave. Her real name is Peruere.

customize.text: The Fourth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Knave. She is a descendant of the Crimson Moon Dynasty of Khaenri'ah and a "Father" of the House of the Hearth. Arlecchino became the Harbinger after killing the previous Knave.

customize.name: Pulcinella
customize.desc: The Fifth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Rooster. He is a mayor of Snezhnaya.

customize.text: The Fifth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Rooster. He is a mayor of Snezhnaya.

customize.name: Scaramouche
customize.desc: The former sixth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, created by Raiden Ei.

customize.text: The Sixth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as The Balladeer. He is a puppet created by Raiden Ei. After Scaramouche erased himself from

customize.name: Irminsul
customize.desc: Irminsul can be thought of as a large tree growing downwards rather than upwards, containing all the knowledge and wisdom of the world from ancient times to the present. Ley Lines, like the roots of Irminsul, cross the earth, absorbing the memories of the world.

customize.text: and became

customize.name: Wanderer
customize.desc: A wayfaring figure whose identity is a mystery. He dresses like a mountain ascetic, but he certainly does not act the part.

customize.text: , it is now considered that the place of the sixth Harbinger has been vacant for several hundreds of years. The Doctor tried to create an Archon from The Balladeer using the Electro

customize.name: Gnosis
customize.desc: Gnoses are internal magical foci that each of The Seven possesses, allowing them to resonate directly with Celestia itself and serving as an emblem of their status. The Gnoses were created from the remains of the Third Descender.

customize.name: Sandrone
customize.desc: The Seventh of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Marionette.

customize.text: The Seventh of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Marionette. She is interested in research and machines.

customize.name: La Signora
customize.desc: The Eighth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, also known as The Fair Lady. Her real name is Rosalyne-Kruzchka Lohefalter.

customize.text: The Eighth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, also known as The Fair Lady. She was a Mondstadter named Rosalyne-Kruzchka Lohefalter. During the

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.text: , she was in Sumeru, and when she returned to Mondstadt, she found her beloved dead. Out of grief, she drank a liquid flame and became the Crimson Witch of Flames. La Signora was executed by

customize.name: Raiden Shogun
customize.desc: Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, who promised the people of Inazuma an unchanging Eternity.

customize.text: in a duel before the throne. After her death, the eighth rank is vacant.

customize.name: Pantalone
customize.desc: The Ninth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Regrator. He is in charge of Snezhnaya's economic policies.

customize.text: The Ninth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Regrator. He is in charge of Snezhnaya's economic policies.

customize.desc: The Eleventh of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Childe. His real name is Ajax.

customize.text:
The Eleventh of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, known as Childe. He is a skillful fighter who considers the Traveler a friend.
The former Knave and "Mother" of the House of the Hearth. She was killed by Arlecchino.
Notable Fatui

customize.name: Lyney
customize.desc: A famed Fontainian magician who possesses great stage presence as well as gift of the gab. Audiences are enthralled by his exquisite skills, and they hang on to his every clever word.

customize.name: Lynette
customize.desc: A magic assistant of few words, her emotions are as inscrutable as any cat's.

customize.name: Freminet
customize.desc: A reserved young man who is well-versed in diving. Beneath his distant, icy demeanor lies a pure heart bereft of all flaws.

customize.text:
Children of the House of the Hearth who serve Arlecchino.
Clervie
Crucabena's daughter and Arlecchino's childhood friend.

customize.name: Baulande
customize.desc: The Fatui peripheral personnel. He is also known under a codename Baulard.

customize.desc: A former Fatuus who started a new life in Inazuma.

The commander of the ninth company which was sent to the Liyue Chasm to investigate the Wish Granter.
Katarina
A member of the ninth company, Lyudochka's friend, and Kolya's older sister with whom she grew up in the House of the Hearth.
A.M. Shumilov

Malinovskyi

Fatui Soldiers

customize.name: Frost Operative
customize.desc:
An elite agent among the Fatui.

Selected while still children, they can only become an "Operative" after many long years of training and teaching, after countless rounds have winnowed the field. They are the most outstanding soldiers among the Fatui, with extraordinary skill and unswerving loyalty.

customize.name: Wind Operative
customize.desc:
An elite agent among the Fatui.

"Operatives" have no ordinary military rank among the Fatui. Based on their orders and the content of their missions, they can work in concert with other soldiers, work alone, or in tandem with the "tacks" hidden and scattered across the world. They spy, conduct counter-espionage, protect, assassinate, and conduct other tasks. In order to effectively carry out missions of a more special nature, "Operatives" also need to master all kinds of other skills and even various arts and talents.

customize.text: Elite agents who are selected while still children. They use the Cryo or Anemo Delusions.

customize.name: Fatui Pyro Agent
customize.desc:
A Fatui secret agent.
The duty of a Fatui agent is to settle debts — but not only those of a monetary or goods-in-kind nature.
They also ensure dues are paid when it comes to the principle of "an eye for an eye." If there is one thing the Fatui are not known for, it is leniency, and whoever dares to oppose them will invoke the full force of their wrath.

customize.text: Secret agents of the Fatui. They use the Pyro Delusion.

customize.name: Mirror Maiden
customize.desc:
A Fatui mage who can command a Hydro Mirror in battle. Her posture is highly dignified, as if she is one who worships a god.
The Hydro Mirror she manipulates lures those enchanted by her to willingly fall for her illusion. Nothing seems to escape her ears. No one knows what those covered eyes have seen, nor what kind of obsession might be reflected in them...

customize.text: Elite members of the Fatui. They use the Hydro Delusion.

customize.name: Fatui Electro Cicin Mage
customize.desc:
A Fatui mage who can command Electro Cicins in battle. Their origins and what they look like under that mask are both mysteries.
Similarly to the way that Electro Cicins go crazy for Mist Grass, Cicin Mages take great pleasure in toying with their prey.

customize.name: Fatui Cryo Cicin Mage
customize.desc:
A Fatui mage who can command Cryo Cicins in battle. Their origins and what they look like under that mask are both mysteries.
Reason dictates that those who lack Visions should not be able to control the elements as these mages do. However, in addition to using Mist Grass to control the Cryo Cicins, they also boldly wield the might of frost. Seeing them as they wander the land in their seemingly aimless way, one can't help but wonder about the duty that must compel them...

customize.text: Fatui mages who use the Mist Grass to control Electro and Cryo Cicins.

customize.name: Fatui Skirmisher - Cryogunner Legionnaire
customize.desc:
A soldier encased within a Fatui war machine.
Armed with equipment that can control the elements to a certain extent, their guns are capable of firing jets of frost.
Though this may confer elemental power beyond the ken of ordinary humans, that power may yet come at a price...

customize.name: Fatui Skirmisher - Hydrogunner Legionnaire
customize.desc:
A soldier encased within a Fatui war machine.
Armed with equipment that can control the elements to a certain extent, their guns are capable of firing jets of water.
These skirmishers do not question if they shall live or die as they advance into nations far from home to complete advance missions and lay the groundwork for operations to come.

customize.name: Fatui Skirmisher - Electrohammer Vanguard
customize.desc:
A sturdily-built skirmisher armed with an Electro-powered war-hammer.
As a Fatui soldier, one has access to munificent resources: salaries, armaments, and supplies.
But at the same time, it also means much time away from home and family and putting one's life in the hands of comrades one has never met.

customize.name: Fatui Skirmisher - Anemoboxer Vanguard
customize.desc:
A skirmisher armed with the ability to manipulate Anemo and heal their comrades.
They departed from their motherland and did so for its sake. They left their family, yet gained allies to stick through thick and thin with.
—Perhaps such thoughts are what get them through the unscrupulous work that their missions entail.

customize.name: Fatui Skirmisher - Pyroslinger Bracer
customize.desc:
A Fatui soldier who wields a flaming gun.
Skirmisher weapons can control the elements to a certain extent, and their combat tactics utilize elemental reactions.
Their ordnance and knowledge of squad-based combat thus constitute no small threat in battle.

customize.name: Fatui Skirmisher - Geochanter Bracer
customize.desc:
A skirmisher with the ability to generate a Geo Shield and defend their allies.
Unlike the elite Mages and Agents, Fatui Skirmishers are soldiers of lesser individual might.
To complete their tasks and reduce losses in men and materiel, their tactics are thus more reliant on teamwork.

customize.text: Fatui soldiers who use special costumes or weapons to control the elemental power.
